sentences.english: Why can the person remove gooseflesh occasionally?
sentences.chinese: 为什么人有时候会起鸡皮疙瘩呢？
我只是感觉起鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: Why, I've got gooseflesh this minute, just thinking about it.
sentences.chinese: 为什么我只要一想到它，这一分钟就起鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: It's giving me the goose bumps just standing here.
sentences.chinese: 站在这里让我感觉直起鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: Oh my goodness, it scared me, and made me have gooseflesh .
sentences.chinese: 天啊，太可怕了，我都起鸡皮疙瘩了。

sentences.english: What reason is often liking to remove gooseflesh ?
sentences.chinese: 老喜欢起鸡皮疙瘩是什么原因啊？

sentences.english: I been creeping all over, ever since I got here.
sentences.chinese: 自打来到这地方，我就浑身直起鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: You try to be sensual, they get creeped out.
sentences.chinese: 你试着去感性的时候，她们则会鸡皮疙瘩掉一地。

sentences.english: The water felt cool on her skin, raising goosebumps.
sentences.chinese: 她感觉水在她皮肤上留下的凉意，激起一阵鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: Lucy: Oh my goodness, it scared me, and made me have gooseflesh.
sentences.chinese: 天啊，太可怕了，我都起鸡皮疙瘩了。

sentences.english: Cucumber feels very cold and gets gooseflesh all over his body.
sentences.chinese: 黄瓜感到很冷，全身冷得起了鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: The friend's explanation lets me remove a gooseflesh.
sentences.chinese: 朋友的解释让我起一层鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: She said that she got goosebumps when she saw the film.
sentences.chinese: 她说自己看那部电影的时候都直起鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: Snape could see the gooseflesh on him.
sentences.chinese: 斯内普可以看到他身上的鸡皮疙瘩。

sentences.english: Goosebumps from my toes on up.
sentences.chinese: 从我的脚趾开始起鸡皮疙瘩。

definition: fine hair on the human body
to have one's hair stand on end (idiom)/to feel one's blood run cold
to tremble/to shiver/uncontrolled shaking of the body
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
variant of 冷戰|冷战[leng3 zhan5]
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
